title: How to Hide the Search Toolbar in Google Chrome

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . Be sure to update Google Chrome . [1] X Research source If needed, you can download Google Chrome . [2] X Research source This method will only hide the address bar for one webpage at a time. You'll need to enter and exit Full Screen Mode to navigate to a new website or webpage.

steps.title: Press the F11 key.
steps.content: Press the F11 key. This will immediately enable Full Screen Mode. [3] X Research source Alternatively, click ⋮ in the top right corner. Click the Full Screen icon next to Zoom . This should look like four corners of a square. To exit Full Screen mode, press F11 or move your cursor to the very top of the window and click the X .

steps.title: Open the View menu.
steps.content: Open the View menu. Click View at the top of the screen. This will open a dropdown menu.

steps.title: Disable Always Show Toolbar in Full Screen.
steps.content: Disable Always Show Toolbar in Full Screen . You’ll see this option near the top of the View menu. If you see a checkmark (✓) next to it, click to disable it. [4] X Research source You can also enable or disable this option with the keyboard shortcut Shift + Command + F .

steps.title: Press Fn+F.
steps.content: Press Fn + F . This will immediately enable Full Screen Mode. Alternatively, click ⋮ in the top right corner. Click the Full Screen icon next to Zoom . This should look like four corners of a square. You can also click the green circular button in the top left corner of the window. To exit Full Screen mode, press Fn + F or move your cursor to the very top of the window and click the red circular button with an X inside at far right.

steps.title: Open a webpage in Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open a webpage in Google Chrome. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click ⋮ in the top right.
steps.content: Click ⋮ in the top right. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Select More tools, then Create shortcut….
steps.content: Select More tools , then Create shortcut… . A new window will appear with Create shortcut? . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Check off Open as window.
steps.content: Check off Open as window . You can also title the page in the text field, but the original page title will still be included.

steps.title: View your new shortcut.
steps.content: View your new shortcut. Your page will open in a new window without an address bar.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Chrome allows you to access , use , and organize bookmarks .

steps.title: Right-click the bookmarks bar.
steps.content: Right-click the bookmarks bar. If you have it enabled, it will be located directly underneath your address bar. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click Show bookmarks bar to deselect it.
steps.content: Click Show bookmarks bar to deselect it. This will remove the bookmarks bar from your browser. [9] X Research source To add the bookmarks bar again, click ⋮ in the top right corner. In the drop-down menu, select Bookmarks , then click Show bookmarks bar .

steps.title: Click the jigsaw icon to the right of the address bar.
steps.content: Click the jigsaw icon to the right of the address bar. This will open a new window for your extensions.

steps.title: Click the push pin icon for the extensions you want hidden.
steps.content: Click the push pin icon for the extensions you want hidden. If the push pin is blue, your extension is pinned and visible in your toolbar. If the push pin is grey, it is not visible in your toolbar. [10] X Research source To show your extensions again, click the push pin icon to turn it blue.
